title: 108_s680
content: Charitable deduction for contributions of book inventories. The amendment to Section 170(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code allows for a special rule for contributions of book inventory for educational purposes. This rule disregards the requirement for the donee to be a specific type of organization when determining if a qualified book contribution is a qualified contribution. The amendment to Section 170(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code allows for a special rule for contributions of book inventory for educational purposes. The property must be used solely for the care of the ill, the needy, or infants, and the reduction in value cannot exceed twice the basis of the property. The term 'qualified book contribution' refers to a charitable donation of books, meeting specific requirements related to the identity of the recipient organization. The curr_chunk discusses the certification requirements for a foundation primarily focused on providing books to the public or operating a literacy program. The donee must certify that the books are suitable for educational programs in terms of currency, content, and quantity. The curr_chunk discusses the criteria for determining the bona fide published market price of books donated for educational programs. The curr_chunk states that taxpayers must demonstrate they customarily sold books at arm's length transactions within 7 years before donating them. The amendments apply to contributions made after the enactment of the Act.
